result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl D Lawhorn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in custody. Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Final pretrial conference held between counsel.  State's motion to adjourn the currently scheduled jury trial date heard and granted.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.    Jury trial date vacated.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Earl D Lawhorn not in court, in custody.  Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant was not produced for today's date.
Case calendared for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Earl D Lawhorn not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today. State is requesting an adjournment.   No objection by the defense.
The court was given a 911 tape to review prior to making any rulings on the state's motion that was filed.
Defense was given a new offer today.
Case adjourned for a status date and another jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion to withdraw as counsel. For reasons stated on the record, the Court denied the defense motion with withdraw. Case remains scheduled for trial on 10/26/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 36.

Attorney Krejci requested a motion hearing date.  Case calendared for 08/14/2015 at 8:30 am.
cab
This assignment is only effective as of 8-3-2015.     mld

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Jeffrey Wagner.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Br. 36.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 36 on 10-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Earl D Lawhorn not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF1641 and 2015CF68.   mld

Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in custody.  Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
addressed to the court, dated 4-15-2015, from Chad and Tina Wilson, received and filed.   mld
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed.

Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to withdraw proceeded.  Court questions defendant as to his request for withdraw of Attorney Krejci.  Court denies motion to withdraw.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  District Attorney Investigator David Dalland    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State does not have the information to file.  Discovery turned over to defense.  State requests an Order seeking revocation of communication privileges signed.  All parties given a copy.   Statement by Shamona C.  She requests modification of the no contact order.  Court denies request for modification of the no contact order.  State moves to join cases 15CF1641 and 15CF68 granted.  Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shamona C. and all of her children (including SB dob 6/1/06); Jacqueline R. or Ivy B

Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Earl D Lawhorn in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. On Court's own motion, Criminal Complaint amended to reflect correct repeater enhancer statute of 939.62(1)(b).  No objection by the parties.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
